subject: p19061282
History: Year old man with HIV who presents with cough and shortness of breath, Interval change Interval change.
Impression: As compared to, the parenchymal consolidation surrounding the right hilus has moderately decreased in extent and severity. The changed likely reflect resolving pneumonia. Moderate cardiomegaly persists. No other pathologic parenchymal process. The radiograph also continues to show multiple cervical soft tissue calcifications as well as punctate splenic calcifications and at diffusely increased bone density, suggesting renal osteodystrophy.
